title: In vitro transcription, capping, and 2'-O methylation of long RNAs
title_html: In vitro transcription, capping, and 2'-O methylation of long RNAs

protocol.title: In vitro transcription, capping, and 2'-O methylation of long RNAs
protocol.title_html: In vitro transcription, capping, and 2'-O methylation of long RNAs

source.description:
Primer design:
pA60 txn rev TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT TTT CTG CAG
pA60 txn fwd CGG CCA GTG AAT TCG AGC TCT AAT ACG ACT CAC TAT AGG
note: if using a different template, substitute the reverse and forward primers for primers that will amplify the forward and reverse of your template. The forward primer should have the T7 promoter in it. If the template does not have a genetically encoded polyA tail, as this one does, then your reverse primer will not have all these T's and instead you will have to polyA tail the RNAs with this:
https://www.neb.com/products/m0276-ecoli-poly-a-polymerase

PCR setup (4x 100ul for each template, four replicate reactions1):
AB
1ReagentAmount per 100 ul reaction
2HF buffer10 ul
3dNTP (10 mM)2 ul
4forward primer (100 uM)0.5 ul
5reverse primer (100 uM)2 ul
6phusion polymerase1 ul
7template (50 ng total)variable
8waterto 100 ul

AB
1ReagentAmount per 100 ul reaction
2HF buffer10 ul
3dNTP (10 mM)2 ul
4forward primer (100 uM)0.5 ul
5reverse primer (100 uM)2 ul
6phusion polymerase1 ul
7template (50 ng total)variable
8waterto 100 ul

Run PCR with a two step protocol:
72 degrees annealing/extension for 3 minutes
98 degrees melting for 30 seconds
repeat 30 cycles
10 minute final extension time at 72
Load all of the PCRs into an agarose gel and verify then size of the template band and then gel purify it

Warm all reagents except T7 polymerase and Superase:IN to room temperature and assemble the reaction at RT.
warning: Adding cold spermidine to template can cause precipitation of the template.

Mix the following together in a 1.5ml tube
AB
1Template DNA1 to 5 ug
2ACGU rNTP mix (25 mM each, pH 8)30 ul
310X transcription buffer (RT)10 ul
41M DTT2 ul
51M MgCl21 ul
6T7 polymerase10 ul
7Superase:IN1 ul
8DEPC H2Oto 100 ul

AB
1Template DNA1 to 5 ug
2ACGU rNTP mix (25 mM each, pH 8)30 ul
310X transcription buffer (RT)10 ul
41M DTT2 ul
51M MgCl21 ul
6T7 polymerase10 ul
7Superase:IN1 ul
8DEPC H2Oto 100 ul

source.body: note: we typically use T7 polymerase we have purified but the Megascript kit in the materials or similar should also work. If using a kit, perform the in vitro transcription according to the kit instructions.

source.description: Incubate at 37 degrees C in a stable incubator - a water bath or stable dry incubator like a thermocycler. Warm rooms and heat blocks can have higher variability in temperature and T7 is a sensitive enzyme.
Wait 1 hour and check the reactions - they should be somewhat cloudy. If they are, add 1 ul of 1 mg/ml pyrophosphatase to each (Roche 10108987001; optional)
Allow the reactions to proceed for 3-4 hours.
Add 1 ul of RQ1 RNase-free DNase to each reaction and incubate at 37 for 30 minutes.
Precipitate by adding 200 ul 0.3M NaOAc pH 5.2, 1 ul GlycoBlue and 750 ul 100% EtOH.
[PAUSE] Incubate at -80 for >1 hour to overnight.
Pellet precipitations by centrifugation at 16,000 g at 4 degrees for 25 minutes.
Aspirate supernatant and discard
Wash with 500 ul -20 degree 70% EtOH
Centrifuge at 16,000 g and 4 degrees for 5 minutes
Aspirate supernatant and discard
Quick-spin and remove residual ethanol with a P20 pipet
Allow pellet to air dry for 5 minutes; do not overdry
Resuspend pellet in 100 ul 50 mM EDTA
Purify RNA over Zymo RNA Clean & Concentrator 25 column following small RNA removal protocol and elute in 30 ul DEPC H2O
Recommended but optional: assess RNA integrity by running a Glyoxal gel before proceeding
Measure concentration of RNA on nanodrop
Dilute 20 ug of RNA in 26 uL DEPC H2O
Prepare a 4mM stock of SAM from the supplied 32 mM stock (4 uL 32mM and 28 uL DEPC H2O for up to 15 reactions)

source.body: note: SAM is unstable and should not be freeze-thawed. If the SAM is degraded, there will not be mRNA capping or methylation.

source.description:
Either add these directly to the tube above, or assemble a master mix according to the following recipe if performing many reactions (note all these reagents are supplied by the corresponding kits):
AB
1ReagentVolume per 40 ul reaction
210X capping buffer4 ul
310 mM GTP2 ul
44 mM SAM2 ul
5Vaccinia capping enzyme2 ul
62'-O-Me transferase2 ul
7RNasin plus (Promega)2 ul

AB
1ReagentVolume per 40 ul reaction
210X capping buffer4 ul
310 mM GTP2 ul
44 mM SAM2 ul
5Vaccinia capping enzyme2 ul
62'-O-Me transferase2 ul
7RNasin plus (Promega)2 ul
Add 14 uL of the master mix to each tube with RNA
Incubate at 37 deg for 60 minutes
Purify over zymo Clean and Concentrator 25 column following small RNA removal protocol and elute in 30 ul DEPC H2O

source.body: if your RNA is not A-tailed from the PCR template and you want it to have a polyA tail, you should A-tail it with E. coli poly-A polymerase at this stage. Follow the kit instructions in materials

source.description:
Run
a glyoxal gel
of all RNAs and verify their size.
Also glyoxylate the ladder and include (typically I use 5ul of either of the ladders listed above)
Use Image Lab to quantify the full-length band and use this to determine concentration in combination with nanodrop or qubit readings.
If significant truncated products are present I recommend agarose gel purification of full-length RNA using the Zymo Agarose Gel Zymoclean kit (R1011)

description:
This protocol is for in vitro transcription of long RNAs off plasmid or PCR product templates. It is assumed that the template has been gel purified, is the right size, has a T7 promoter and a 3' polyA tail (typically A60). Following this protocol the RNA will be ready for transfection into mammalian cells or in vitro translation. Significant amounts of template are necessary: at least 1ug of template per 100ul reaction; ideally closer to 5ug of template, especially for very long templates. Use RNase sensitive protocols and reagents for all steps of this procedure.
The basic protocol is:
- PCR amplification of the template
- in vitro transcription
- capping and 2'-O-Methylation
- quality control and optional purification
Based on protocols from Kaihong Zhou (Doudna lab) and RNA: A Laboratory Manual (Rio, Ares, Hannon, Nilsen).
